item.title: America by Allen Ginsberg
Imagine by John Lennon
item.description: by [[John Lennon]] no countries, no religion, no possessions, no division no hunger anti-war pacifist John Lennon asks us to imagine a world, a dream world where humanity is free of conflicts and barriers.

item.title: Partition by W.H Auden
item.description: by W.H. Auden About the Author Summary and themes about the India - Pakistan partition in 1947 angry about partition, directed towards Radcliffe

item.title: Preludes
item.description: [!NOTE]- Poem The winter evening settes down With smell of steaks in passagewats Six o’clock The burnt-out ends of smoky days.

item.title: Sailing to Byzantium by WB Yeats
item.description: by ![[WB Yeats]] written in 1926 Yeats was in his 60s “the state of my soul and some of my thoughts about the subject” time of industrial revolution
